metadata.title: CVE-2022-23121 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - high
metadata.description:
This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code onaffected installations of Netatalk. Authentication is not required toexploit this vulnerability. The specific flaw exists within theparse_entries function. The issue results from the lack of proper errorhandling when parsing AppleDouble entries. An attacker can leverage thisvulnerability to execute code in the context of root. Was ZDI-CAN-15819.This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code onaffected installations of Netatalk. Authentication is not required toexploit this vulnerability.The specific flaw exists within the parse_entries function. The issueresults from the lack of proper error handling when parsing AppleDoubleentries. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in thecontext of root.]

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-23121` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

netatalk - 3.1.12~ds-4ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: netatalk package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.1.12~ds-4ubuntu0.20.04.1').
